page.title: 15INDUSTRY AEROSPACE EMPLOYEE.
page.content: I interviewed Mr.John Nelson who works at BAe in Warton, in the aerodynamics department. He works on the study of the airflow around an aircraft. He helps to design the shape of the E.F.A. His work involves analysis of wind tunnel results to decide on the best shape and using the wind tunnel data to predict the aircraft's performance. This involves very complicated mathematical problems which can only be solved by using powerful computers.There are one hundred and ten people working in aerodynamics and most of them have a university degree in either aeronautical engineering or science. The working conditions in the aerodynamics department are good with a modern air-conditioned office block.
